We hope this communication finds you and your students doing well. We are excited to report that Hunt Elementary our Balanced Calendar school started back to school this week. I wish I could convey the joy it was to have students back in our buildings once again.

I am sure that you are all anxiously awaiting information from your principals and teachers regarding start dates and cohort assignments. At this time, no lists or cohorts have been permanently assigned and we ask for you patience as we work through these details. It is our plan to have this information to all grades by Wednesday, August 12, 2020.

JPS Principals will communicate to their families all information through phone, email, text, JPS app and FB pages. So stay tuned.

Sincerely,

Jeff Beal

JPS Superintendent

Good evening JPS Families and Staff,

Today, Governor Whitmer held a press conference to lay out the Return To School Road Map for all Michigan Schools. This road map is extensive and requires planning.

At this time JPS has assembled our Return to Learn Committee and will be reviewing the Governor's Road Map and making plans for JPS students and staff to return to safely to school this Fall 2020.

We ask for patience as we process the information of the Governors' Road Map to Return to School Plan and make the very safest plan for JPS. We like many of you want to return to face to face learning and bring our community together again.

Although I do not have an exact date that we will provide our plans to you please know it is my commitment to work through this process with our committee as quickly as possible and communicate those plans to all of you. Please have a safe and fun July 4th holiday.

Jeff Beal
Superintendent
Jackson Public Schools

Sincerely,

Jennifer Vinitski

Maintenance Tech Needed

CHARACTERISTICS OF THE CLASS:
Under general direction, is responsible for the operation, minor repair and maintenance of buildings, grounds, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, pool, clock systems and all related equipment.

EXAMPLES OF DUTIES:
Locks and unlocks buildings; operates and inspects boilers; operates swimming pool and equipment; inspects plumbing, heating, ventilation and electrical equipment for necessary repairs or replacement; makes necessary minor repairs; responsible for filling out work orders; investigates causes for defects; maintains water and sewer lines; orders necessary supplies and equipment; prepares time reports and maintains simple records; is responsible for week-end building check when assigned; may work in more than one building. Places and removes chairs and equipment for meetings and activities. Performs other related duties as required.

Interested parties should email a resume to Jeff Huey at jeff.huey@jpsk12.org.

Maintenance Tech Needed

CHARACTERISTICS OF THE CLASS:
Under general direction, is responsible for the operation, minor repair and maintenance of buildings, grounds, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, pool, clock systems and all related equipment.

EXAMPLES OF DUTIES:
Locks and unlocks buildings; operates and inspects boilers; operates swimming pool and equipment; inspects plumbing, heating, ventilation and electrical equipment for necessary repairs or replacement; makes necessary minor repairs; responsible for filling out work orders; investigates causes for defects; maintains water and sewer lines; orders necessary supplies and equipment; prepares time reports and maintains simple records; is responsible for week-end building check when assigned; may work in more than one building. Places and removes chairs and equipment for meetings and activities. Performs other related duties as required.

Interested parties should email a resume to Jeff Huey at jeff.huey@jpsk12.org.
